detailed_info.name: Hydroxypropyl Methylcellulose
detailed_info.description: Hydroxypropyl methylcellulose (hypromellose, HPMC) is a synthetic polymer used as a thickener, emulsifier or foaming agent. It dissolves in water to thicken and form a gel. It is used as a food additive under the name E464. It is produced using cellulose and propylene oxide. For these reasons, the ingredient is accompanied by an orange flower on our application.

functions.name: Antistatic
functions.description: Reduces static electricity by neutralizing electrical charge on a surface

functions.name: Binding agent
functions.description: Allows the cohesion of different cosmetic ingredients

functions.name: Emulsion stabilising
functions.description: Promotes the emulsification process and improves the stability and shelf life of the emulsion

functions.name: Film forming
functions.description: Produces a continuous film on skin, hair or nails

functions.name: Surfactant
functions.description: Reduces the surface tension of cosmetics and contributes to the even distribution of the product when it is used

functions.name: Viscosity controlling
functions.description: Increases or decreases the viscosity of cosmetics
